text: Often takes others' eyes to uncover those unnoticed gems.
Benches are just waiting places; charm's subjective.
People rave over chic cafes but overlook those roundabouts adorned with intricate sculptures; eye-catchers among standby tail lights!
Fountains here so overrated – find solace under old ghaf trees instead.
Jasmine smells great! But traffic noises snap you back quick.
Honestly? For me, it was signing off on major projects—not just theoretical stuff but decisions impacting real economies—that hammered home the weight of being grown-up.
Adulting hit different for me when leading emergency drills back home – turns out keeping people safe feels more grown-up than signing any deal ever did!
"Gushing over oil prices? Hardly our daily chat."
"Oil tycoon" label? Far from daily grit of rig life!
Age milestones? More like unnecessary social constructs.
Desert roots made lush greenery abroad astonishingly alien!
Desert dunes vs sea waves - total reset!
First Oktoberfest honestly threw me; felt like stepping onto another planet where time-honored rituals overrule daily hustle—even splurged on tradition-tinted souvenirs!
